name: Life Insurance
description: Providers of life insurance policies that offer financial protection to beneficiaries in the event of the policyholder's death, often including term life, whole life, and universal life insurance products.

name: Health Insurance
description: Companies that offer health insurance plans, providing financial coverage for medical expenses, including hospital stays, doctor visits, and prescription medications.

name: Property Insurance
description: Insurers that provide coverage for damage or loss to physical properties, such as homes, buildings, and personal belongings, due to natural disasters, theft, or other perils.

name: Liability Insurance
description: Providers of liability insurance policies that protect individuals and businesses from financial losses resulting from lawsuits, accidents, or other events that may cause harm to others.

name: Auto Insurance
description: Insurers that offer policies covering damage or loss to vehicles, as well as liability for accidents or other incidents involving vehicles.

name: Reinsurance
description: Companies that provide insurance to other insurance companies, helping to manage risk and provide additional financial protection.

name: Specialty Insurance
description: Providers of niche insurance products, such as title insurance, crop insurance, and aviation insurance, that cater to specific industries or risks.

name: Insurance Brokers
description: Intermediaries that connect clients with insurance providers, offering expert advice and policy placement services.

name: Insurance Technology
description: Companies that develop and provide technology solutions, such as software and data analytics, to support the insurance industry's operations and innovation.

name: Insurance Consulting
description: Firms that offer strategic guidance and expertise to insurance companies, helping them to improve operations, manage risk, and optimize performance.

name: Captive Insurance
description: Insurance companies that are owned and controlled by their policyholders, often used by businesses to self-insure and manage risk.

name: Microinsurance
description: Providers of low-cost, limited-risk insurance products designed for low-income individuals or communities, often in emerging markets.
